ai_summary.Response: The provided commit modifies a documentation file detailing FIDO2 hardware vendors. Specifically, it updates the entry for the 'Arculus FIDO 2.1 Key Card' and 'Arculus FIDO2/U2F Key Card'. The changes reflect an update to the support status for these devices across different FIDO2 capabilities.

author: Courtney Wales
message:
Merge pull request #1551 from anchoub/patch-4

Update concept-sspr-howitworks.md

  "patch": "@@ -22,7 +22,7 @@ Microsoft Entra self-service password reset (SSPR) gives users the ability to ch\n \n ## How does the password reset process work?\n \n-A user can reset or change their password using the [SSPR portal](https://aka.ms/sspr). They must first register their desired authentication methods. When a user accesses the SSPR portal, the Microsoft Entra platform considers the following factors:\n+A user can reset or change their password using the [SSPR portal](https://aka.ms/sspr). Also to highlight SSPR for Administrators isn't enabled on the tenant by default as SSPR is only for the end users.  They must first register their desired authentication methods. When a user accesses the SSPR portal, the Microsoft Entra platform considers the following factors:\n \n * How should the page be localized?\n * Is the user account valid?"
}. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response:
Here's a summary of the commit:

This change modifies the `concept-sspr-howitworks.md` documentation file. It adds a clarification that Self-Service Password Reset (SSPR) is primarily for end-users and is not enabled for administrators by default within a tenant. The core functionality and the process of how a user registers authentication methods and accesses the SSPR portal remain unchanged.
